text.div: Questionnaire response from the DEL Demo Client.

item.text: Section F: Preferences for Customary Routine and Activities
Living Arrangements
Identify the {patient's/resident's} usual living arrangement during the past 3 days and the past month.
Identify the {patient's/resident's} usual living arrangement during the past 3 days

valueCoding.display: Person lives alone - no other residents in the home.

item.text: Identify the {patient's/resident's} usual living arrangement during the past month.

valueCoding.display: Person lives alone - no other residents in the home.

item.text: Living Arrangement Priorities: Please ask the {patient/resident} to describe at least one or two personal priorities in the area of living arrangements for the next six months. If the {patient/resident} does not express any personal priorities in this area, please not this below. - A

Living Arrangement Priorities: Please ask the {patient/resident} to describe at least one or two personal priorities in the area of living arrangements for the next six months. If the {patient/resident} does not express any personal priorities in this area, please not this below. - B
Availability of Assistance
Does the {patient/resident} have assistance in their home?

valueCoding.display: No

item.text: Code the level of assistance in the {patient's/resident's} home (both paid and unpaid) during the past month.
Code the level of assistance in the {patient's/resident's} home (both paid and unpaid) during the past month. - Paid

valueCoding.display: No assistance received

item.text: Code the level of assistance in the {patient's/resident's} home (both paid and unpaid) during the past month. - Unpaid

valueCoding.display: No assistance received

item.text: Availability or Paid and Unpaid Assistance. Code the Paid and Unpaid caregiver's usual ability and willingness to provide assistance with each activity during the past 3 days. If the activity was not attempted, code as Not Applicable.
Availability of Assistance - Paid
Self-care assistance (for example, bathing, dressing, toileting, or eating/feeding) - Paid

valueCoding.display: Assistance not needed - No assistance needed.

item.text: Mobility assistance (for example, bed mobility, transfers, ambulating, or wheeling). - Paid

valueCoding.display: Assistance not needed - No assistance needed.

item.text: IADL assistance (for example, making meals, housekeeping, telephone, shopping or finances). - Paid

valueCoding.display: Assistance not needed - No assistance needed.

item.text: Medication administration (for example, oral, inhaled, or injectable medications). - Paid

valueCoding.display: Assistance not needed - No assistance needed.

item.text: Medical procedures/treatments (for example, changing wound dressing, or home exercise program). - Paid

valueCoding.display: Assistance not needed - No assistance needed.

item.text: Management of equipment (for example, oxygen, IV/infusion equipment, enteral/parenteral nutrition, or ventilator therapy equipment and supplies). - Paid

valueCoding.display: Assistance not needed - No assistance needed.

item.text: Supervision (for example, due to safety concerns). - Paid

valueCoding.display: Assistance not needed - No assistance needed.

item.text: Advocacy or facilitation of {person's} participation in appropriate medical care (for example, transportation to or from appointments). - Paid

valueCoding.display: Assistance not needed - No assistance needed.

item.text: Availability of Assistance - Unpaid
Self-care assistance (for example, bathing, dressing, toileting, or eating/feeding). - Unpaid

valueCoding.display: Assistance not needed - No assistance needed.

item.text: Mobility assistance (for example, bed mobility, transfers, ambulating, or wheeling). - Unpaid

valueCoding.display: Assistance not needed - No assistance needed.

item.text: IADL assistance (for example, making meals, housekeeping, telephone, shopping, or finances). - Unpaid

valueCoding.display: Assistance not needed - No assistance needed.

item.text: Medication administration (for example, oral, inhaled, or injectable medications). - Unpaid

valueCoding.display: Assistance not needed - No assistance needed.

item.text: Medical procedures/treatments (for example, changing wound dressing, or home exercise program). - Unpaid

valueCoding.display: Assistance not needed - No assistance needed.

item.text: Management of equipment (for example, oxygen, IV/infusion equipment, enteral/parenteral nutrition, or ventilator therapy equipment and supplies). - Unpaid

valueCoding.display: Assistance not needed - No assistance needed.

item.text: Supervision (for example, due to safety concerns). - Unpaid

valueCoding.display: Assistance not needed - No assistance needed.

item.text: Advocacy or facilitation of {person's} participation in appropriate medical care (for example, transportation to or from appointments). - Unpaid

valueCoding.display: Assistance not needed - No assistance needed.

item.text: Caregiving Arrangement Priorities: Please ask the {patient/resident} to describe at least one or two personal priorities in the area of caregiving for the next six months. If the {patient/resident} does not express any personal priorities in this area, please not this below. - A

Caregiving Priorities: Please ask the {patient/resident} to describe at least one or two personal priorities in the area of caregiving for the next six months. If the {patient/resident} does not express any personal priorities in this area, please not this below. - B
Section GG: Functional Abilities and Goals
Self-Care.
Self-Care. Code the {patient's/resident's} Usual performance during the past 3 days using the 6-point scale. If the activity was not attempted, document using a Not Attempted code reason.
Eating: The ability to use suitable utensils to bring food and/or liquid to the mouth and swallow food and/or liquid once the meal is placed before the {person}. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Oral hygiene: The ability to use suitable items to clean teeth. Dentures (if applicable): The ability to insert and remove dentures into and from the mouth, and manage denture soaking and rinsing with use of equipment. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Toileting hygiene: The ability to maintain perineal/menstrual hygiene and adjust clothes before and after voiding or having a bowel movement. If managing an ostomy, include wiping the opening, but not managing equipment. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Wash upper body: The ability to wash, rinse, and dry the face, hands, chest, and arms while sitting in a chair or bed. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Shower/bathe self: The ability to bathe self, including washing, rinsing, and drying self. Does not include transferring in/out of tub/shower. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Upper body dressing: The ability to dress and undress above the waist; including fasteners, if applicable. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Lower body dressing: The ability to dress and undress below the waist, including fasteners; does not include footwear. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Putting on/taking off footwear: The ability to put on and take off socks and shoes or other footwear that is appropriate for safe mobility; including fasteners, if applicable. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Self-Care. If the {patient's/resident's} performance changed during the past month, code their Most Dependent performance.  If the {patient's/resident's} self-care performance was unchanged during the past month, the Most Dependent performance should be coded the same as the level recorded in Usual.  It the activity was not attempted, document using a Not Attempted code reason.
Eating: The ability to use suitable utensils to bring food and/or liquid to the mouth and swallow food and/or liquid once the meal is placed before the {person}. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Oral hygiene: The ability to use suitable items to clean teeth. Dentures (if applicable): The ability to insert and remove dentures into and from the mouth, and manage denture soaking and rinsing with use of equipment. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Toileting hygiene: The ability to maintain perineal/menstrual hygiene and adjust clothes before and after voiding or having a bowel movement. If managing an ostomy, include wiping the opening, but not managing equipment. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Wash upper body: The ability to wash, rinse, and dry the face, hands, chest, and arms while sitting in a chair or bed. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Shower/bathe self: The ability to bathe self, including washing, rinsing, and drying self. Does not include transferring in/out of tub/shower. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Upper body dressing: The ability to dress and undress above the waist; including fasteners, if applicable. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Lower body dressing: The ability to dress and undress below the waist, including fasteners; does not include footwear. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Putting on/taking off footwear: The ability to put on and take off socks and shoes or other footwear that is appropriate for safe mobility; including fasteners, if applicable. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Mobility.
Mobility. Code the {patient's/resident's} Usual performance during the past 3 days using the 6-point scale. If the activity was not attempted, document using a Not Attempted code reason.
Roll left and right: The ability to roll from lying on back to left and right side, and return to lying on back. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Sit to lying: The ability to move from sitting on side of bed to lying flat on the bed. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Lying to sitting on side of bed: The ability to move from lying on the back to sitting on the side of the bed with feet flat on the floor, and with no back support. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Sit to stand: The ability to come to a standing position from sitting in a chair, wheelchair, or on the side of the bed. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Chair/bed-to-chair transfer: The ability to transfer to and from a bed to a chair (or wheelchair). - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Toilet transfer: The ability to get on and off a toilet or commode. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Car transfer: The ability to transfer in and out of a car or van on the passenger side. Does not include the ability to open/close door or fasten seat belt. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Walk 10 feet: Once standing, the ability to walk at least 10 feet in a room, corridor, or similar space. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Walk 50 feet with two turns: Once standing, the ability to walk at least 50 feet and make two turns. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Walk 150 feet: Once standing, the ability to walk at least 150 feet in a corridor or similar space. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Walk 10 feet on uneven surfaces: The ability to walk 10 feet on uneven or sloping surfaces (indoor or outdoor), such as turf or gravel. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: 1 step (curb): The ability to go up and down a curb and/or up and down one step. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: 4 steps: The ability to go up and down four steps with or without a rail. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: 12 steps: The ability to go up and down 12 steps with or without a rail. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Picking up object: The ability to bend/stoop from a standing position to pick up a small object, such as a spoon, from the floor. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Walk indoors: The ability to walk from room to room, around furniture and other obstacles. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Carries something in both hands: The ability to carry something in both hands while walking indoors (e.g., several dishes, light laundry basket, tray with food). - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Walk for 15 minutes: The ability to walk without stopping or resting (e.g., through a department store, supermarket). - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Walk across a street: The ability to cross street before light turns red. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Mobility. If the {patient's/resident's} performance changed during the past month, code their Most Dependent performance. If the {patient's/resident's} mobility performance was unchanged during the past month, the Most Dependent performance should be coded the same as the level recorded in Usual. It the activity was not attempted, document using a Not Attempted code reason.
Roll left and right: The ability to roll from lying on back to left and right side, and return to lying on back. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Sit to lying: The ability to move from sitting on side of bed to lying flat on the bed. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Lying to sitting on side of bed: The ability to move from lying on the back to sitting on the side of the bed with feet flat on the floor, and with no back support. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Chair/bed-to-chair transfer: The ability to transfer to and from a bed to a chair (or wheelchair). - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Toilet transfer: The ability to get on and off a toilet or commode. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Car transfer: The ability to transfer in and out of a car or van on the passenger side. Does not include the ability to open/close door or fasten seat belt. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Walk 50 feet with two turns: Once standing, the ability to walk at least 50 feet and make two turns. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: 1 step (curb): The ability to go up and down a curb and/or up and down one step. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: 4 steps: The ability to go up and down four steps with or without a rail. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: 12 steps: The ability to go up and down 12 steps with or without a rail. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Picking up object: The ability to bend/stoop from a standing position to pick up a small object, such as a spoon, from the floor. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Walk indoors: The ability to walk from room to room, around furniture and other obstacles. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Carries something in both hands: The ability to carry something in both hands while walking indoors (e.g., several dishes, light laundry basket, tray with food). - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Walk for 15 minutes: The ability to walk without stopping or resting (e.g., through a department store, supermarket). - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Does the {patient/resident} walk?

valueCoding.display: No, and walking goal is not indicated

item.text: Self-Care Priorities: Please ask the {patient/resident} to describe at least one or two personal priorities in the area of self-care for the next six months. If the {patient/resident} does not express any personal priorities in this area, please note this below.

Self-Care Priorities: Please ask the {patient/resident} to describe at least one or two personal priorities in the area of self-care for the next six months. If the {patient/resident} does not express any personal priorities in this area, please note this below.
Mobility (Wheelchair).
Does the {patient/resident} use a manual wheelchair?

valueCoding.display: No

item.text: Code the {patient's/resident's} Usual performance during the past 3 days using the 6-point scale. If the activity was not attempted, document using a Not Attempted code reason.
Wheel 50 feet with two turns: Once seated in wheelchair, the ability to wheel at least 50 feet and make two turns. - Manual Wheelchair - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Wheel 150 feet: Once seated in wheelchair, the ability to wheel at least 150 feet in a corridor or similar space. - Manual Wheelchair - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Wheel for 15 minutes: Once seated in wheelchair, the ability to wheel without stopping or resting (e.g., through a department store, supermarket). - Manual Wheelchair - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Wheel across a street: Once seated in wheelchair, the ability to wheel across a street before light turns red. - Manual Wheelchair - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: If the {patient's/resident's} performance changed during the past month, also code their Most Dependent performance. If the {patient's/resident's} wheelchair mobility performance was unchanged during the past month, the Most Dependent response should be coded the same as the level recorded in Usual. If the activity was not attempted, document using a Not Attempted code reason.
Wheel 50 feet with two turns: Once seated in wheelchair, the ability to wheel at least 50 feet and make two turns. - Manual Wheelchair - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Wheel 150 feet: Once seated in wheelchair, the ability to wheel at least 150 feet in a corridor or similar space. - Manual Wheelchair - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Wheel for 15 minutes: Once seated in wheelchair, the ability to wheel without stopping or resting (e.g., through a department store, supermarket). - Manual Wheelchair - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Wheel across a street: Once seated in wheelchair, the ability to wheel across a street before light turns red. - Manual Wheelchair - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Does the {patient/resident} use a motorized wheelchair and/or scooter?

valueCoding.display: No

item.text: Code the {patient's/resident's} Usual performance during the past 3 days using the 6-point scale. If the activity was not attempted, document using a Not Attempted code reason.
Wheel 50 feet with two turns: Once seated in wheelchair/scooter, the ability to wheel at least 50 feet and make two turns. - Motorized Wheelchair/Scooter - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Wheel 150 feet: Once seated in wheelchair/scooter, the ability to wheel at least 150 feet in a corridor or similar space. - Motorized Wheelchair/Scooter - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Wheel for 15 minutes: Once seated in wheelchair/scooter, the ability to wheel without stopping or resting (e.g., through a department store, supermarket). - Motorized Wheelchair/Scooter - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Wheel across a street: Once seated in wheelchair/scooter, the ability to wheel across a street before light turns red. - Motorized Wheelchair/Scooter - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: If the {patient's/resident's} performance changed during the past month, also code their Most Dependent performance. If the {patient's/resident's} wheelchair mobility performance was unchanged during the past month, the Most Dependent response should be coded the same as the level recorded in Usual. If the activity was not attempted, document using a Not Attempted code reason.
Wheel 50 feet with two turns: Once seated in wheelchair/scooter, the ability to wheel at least 50 feet and make two turns. - Motorized Wheelchair/Scooter - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Wheel 150 feet: Once seated in wheelchair/scooter, the ability to wheel at least 150 feet in a corridor or similar space. - Motorized Wheelchair/Scooter - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Wheel for 15 minutes: Once seated in wheelchair/scooter, the ability to wheel without stopping or resting (e.g., through a department store, supermarket). - Motorized Wheelchair/Scooter - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Wheel across a street: Once seated in wheelchair/scooter, the ability to wheel across a street before light turns red. - Motorized Wheelchair/Scooter - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Does the {patient/resident} use a manual wheelchair?

valueCoding.display: No

item.text: Mobility Priorities: Please ask the {patient/resident} to describe at least one or two personal priorities in the area of mobility for the next six months. If the {patient/resident} does not express any personal priorities in this area, please note this below. - A

Mobility Priorities: Please ask the {patient/resident} to describe at least one or two personal priorities in the area of mobility for the next six months. If the {patient/resident} does not express any personal priorities in this area, please note this below. - B
Instrumental Activities of Daily Living.
Code the {patient's/resident's} Usual Performance during the past 3 days using the 6-point scale. If the activity was not attempted, document using a Not Attempted code reason.
Makes a light cold meal: The ability to plan and prepare all aspects of a light cold meal such as a bowl of cereal and sandwich and cold drink. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Makes a light hot meal: The ability to plan and prepare all aspects of a light hot meal such as heating a bowl of soup and reheating a prepared meal. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Light daily housework: The ability to complete light daily housework to maintain a safe home environment such that the {patient/resident} is not at risk from harm within their home.  Examples include wiping counter tops or doing dishes. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Heavier periodic housework: The ability to complete heavier periodic housework to maintain a safe home environment such that the {patient/resident} is not at risk for harm within their home.  Examples include doing laundry, vacuuming, cleaning bathroom. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Light shopping: Once at store, can locate and select up to five needed goods, take to check out, and complete purchasing transaction. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Telephone-answering call: The ability to answer call in {patient's/resident's} customary manner and maintain for 1 minute or longer.  Does not include getting to the phone. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Telephone-placing call: The ability to place call in {patient's/resident's} customary manner and maintain for 1 minute or longer.  Does not include getting to the phone. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Medication management-oral medications: The ability to prepare and take all prescribed oral medications reliably and safely, including administration of the correct dosage at the appropriate times/intervals. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Medication management-inhalant/mist medications: The ability to prepare and take all prescribed inhalant/mist medications reliably and safely, including administration of the correct dosage at the appropriate times/intervals. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Medication management-injectable medications: The ability to prepare and take all prescribed injectable medications reliably and safely, including administration of the correct dosage at the appropriate times/intervals. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Simple financial management: The ability to complete financial transactions such as counting coins, verifying change for a single item transaction, writing a check, online/mobile bill pay, banking, or shopping. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Complex financial management: The ability to complete financial decision-making such as budget and remembering to pay bills. - Usual Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: If the {patient's/resident's} performance changed during the past month, also code their Most Dependent performance. If the {patient's/resident's} IADL performance was unchanged during the past month, the Most Dependent response should be coded the same as the level recorded in Usual. If the activity was not attempted, document using a Not Attempted code reason.
Makes a light cold meal: The ability to plan and prepare all aspects of a light cold meal such as a bowl of cereal and sandwich and cold drink. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Makes a light hot meal: The ability to plan and prepare all aspects of a light hot meal such as heating a bowl of soup and reheating a prepared meal. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Light daily housework: The ability to complete light daily housework to maintain a safe home environment such that the {patient/resident} is not at risk from harm within their home.  Examples include wiping counter tops or doing dishes. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Heavier periodic housework: The ability to complete heavier periodic housework to maintain a safe home environment such that the {patient/resident} is not at risk for harm within their home.  Examples include doing laundry, vacuuming, cleaning bathroom. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Light shopping: Once at store, can locate and select up to five needed goods, take to check out, and complete purchasing transaction. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Telephone-answering call: The ability to answer call in {resident's/patient's} customary manner and maintain for 1 minute or longer.  Does not include getting to the phone. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Telephone-placing call: The ability to place call in {patient's/resident's} customary manner and maintain for 1 minute or longer.  Does not include getting to the phone. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Medication management-oral medications: The ability to prepare and take all prescribed oral medications reliably and safely, including administration of the correct dosage at the appropriate times/intervals. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Medication management-inhalant/mist medications: The ability to prepare and take all prescribed inhalant/mist medications reliably and safely, including administration of the correct dosage at the appropriate times/intervals. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Medication management-injectable medications: The ability to prepare and take all prescribed injectable medications reliably and safely, including administration of the correct dosage at the appropriate times/intervals. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Simple financial management: The ability to complete financial transactions such as counting coins, verifying change for a single item transaction, writing a check, online/mobile bill pay, banking, or shopping. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: Complex financial management: The ability to complete financial decision-making such as budget and remembering to pay bills. - Most Dependent Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - Person completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.

item.text: IADL Priorities: Please ask the {patient/resident} to describe at least one or two personal priorities in the area of instrumental activities of daily living for the next six months. If the {patient/resident} does not express any personal priorities in this area, please note this below. - A

IADL Priorities: Please ask the {patient/resident} to describe at least one or two personal priorities in the area of instrumental activities of daily living for the next six months. If the {patient/resident} does not express any personal priorities in this area, please note this below. - B
Assistive Devices for Everyday Activities.
